questions.question: Is the grid of yellow rounded domes covering the surface of the cake present?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the surface of the cake is topped with a grid of yellow rounded domes, indicating a consistent design across the top of the cake. This is confirmed by the visual cues.

questions.question: Are there small red dots on top of each yellow dome?
questions.explanation: Upon examining Image B, small red dots are visible on top of some but not all of the yellow domes, suggesting a pattern or design choice.

questions.question: Is the cross-section showing a golden sponge base, white cream layer, and deep red jam layer visible?
questions.explanation: In Image B, a slice of the cake is removed, revealing a cross-section that clearly shows layers of golden sponge at the bottom, white cream in the middle, and a deep red jam layer above it.

questions.question: Are two strawberries with green leaves positioned at the top center of the cake?
questions.explanation: Image B displays two strawberries along with some greenery positioned at the top center of the cake. These visual elements are easily identifiable.

questions.question: Are chopped nuts visible around the base of the cake?
questions.explanation: In Image B, chopped nuts are visibly scattered around the base of the cake, forming a textural contrast with the smooth surface of the casing.

questions.question: Does the cake maintain a square shape?
questions.explanation: The cake in Image B has a square outline, particularly visible in the overall symmetrical visual structure despite the bite taken out of one corner.

questions.question: Is the cake placed on a silver-toned plate with an embossed floral pattern?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the cake placed on a shiny silver-toned plate, and the delicate embossed floral pattern is distinctly visible, supporting this description.

questions.question: Is the deep red jam layer clearly visible between the white cream and golden sponge?
questions.explanation: The cross-section of the cake in Image B showcases a visible deep red jam layer sandwiched between the white cream and golden sponge layers, confirming its presence.

questions.question: Is the white cream layer visible between the sponge and jam layers?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the cross-section reveals a white cream layer clearly situated between the golden sponge base and the deep red jam layer.

questions.question: Is the golden sponge base layer visible in the cross-section?
questions.explanation: The cross-section in Image B includes a golden sponge base at the bottom layer of the cake, characterized by its distinct color and texture contrast.
